title: Two-day Independence Festival commences at F-9 Park
content:
ISLAMABAD, Aug 13 (APP): The two-day Independence Festival was commenced at F-9 Park, offering a historic and enchanting experience for people living in the federal capital.
The highlight of the event was Pakistan’s first-ever drone show, featuring 500 drones that simultaneously illuminated the sky with images of the Pakistani flag and other mesmerizing visuals. This spectacular display was a tribute to the love and spirit of Pakistan.
The festival, open to the public with free entry, provided families with a perfect opportunity to enjoy a memorable outing.
Various entertainment stalls and activities for children, along with food stalls offering a variety of delicious treats, added to the festive atmosphere.
A significant attraction of the celebration was the performances by some of the country’s most renowned artists, who captivated the audience with their talent.
The presence of Olympic gold medalist, Arshad Nadeem, further elevated the event’s prestige. His participation symbolized the remarkable achievements that Pakistan’s youth can attain for their nation.
At midnight on August 13, the sky over Islamabad lit up with a spectacular fireworks display, marking the climax of the celebrations.
The residents of Islamabad had the rare opportunity to celebrate Independence Day grandly with their families, becoming part of a historic moment.
The participants at the Independence Festival 2024 wholeheartedly embraced the spirit of Pakistan’s freedom, making the event a memorable experience. The citizens, especially women and children, praised the event’s grandeur.
Ahmed Khan, a resident, described it as an unforgettable experience, expressing pride in the drone show and urging the government to continue organizing such events.
Fatima Malik, another attendee, shared that her children thoroughly enjoyed the festival, particularly the drone show and fireworks, calling it an excellent family entertainment opportunity.
Maryam Butt, another participant, noted that the performances by the artists made the event unforgettable, highlighting the talent within the country and the importance of such events in promoting culture and unity.
A young attendee, Ali Raza, excitedly mentioned, “I loved the drone show! it was the best show of my life. I never thought I would see something like this.”
The Independence Festival celebrations will continue on August 14 from 4:00 PM to 12:00 AM, offering more opportunities for families to enjoy the festivities.
